intro: Anisomeles macdonaldii, commonly known as the Macdonald's anisomeles, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It is a small shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants found in tropical and subtropical regions. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
